intro: Chaetospora tendo, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in many areas.
